title: EndoC,HNF1A,CUT&RUN
treatment_protocol_ch1: Before use, cells were treated with 1uM tamoxifen (Selleck #S7827) 2x/week for 21 days. Successful excision of the immortalizing transgene was confirmed by observing the cell morphology.
growth_protocol_ch1: EndoC-βH3 cells were cultured on 10cm TPP plates (Sigma #Z707686) as described1. Plates were first coated with ECM solution (10ml of DMEM (Gibco #11960044), 100ul ECM gel (Sigma #E1270), 20ul fibronectin (Sigma #F1141), 100ul Streptomycin-Penicillin (Gibco #15140122), 5ml per 10cm dish) for 1hr at 37°C before use. Cells were cultured in DMEM (Sigma #D6046) with 2% BSA fraction V (Sigma #10775835001), 50uM 2-mercaptoethanol (Gibco #31350010), 10mM Nicotinamide (Sigma #481907), 5.5ug/ml Transferrin (Sigma #T8158), 6.7ng/ml sodium selenite (Sigma #214485), and Penicillin/Streptomycin (Gibco #15140122). Before use, cells were treated with 1uM tamoxifen (Selleck #S7827) 2x/week for 21 days. Successful excision of the immortalizing transgene was confirmed by observing the cell morphology.
extract_protocol_ch1.1: CUTANA™ CUT&RUN Library Prep Kit, primer set two
data_processing: Using the default settings of bowtie2 v2.2.6 to align the paired-end raw reads.
data_processing.1: Next, we use samtools v1.3.1 to sort and extract uniquely mapped reads.
data_processing.2: Then we remove PCR duplications with the default parameter by using picard v1.93, and MACS2 v2.2.7.1 was used to call peaks.
data_processing.3: After having the non-duplicated sorted bam file we converted bam files to bedgraph files using bedtools v 2.25 (bamtobed,genomecov).
data_processing.4: Finally we use bedGraphToBigWig to convert bedGraph to bigWig file then upload to UCSC for track graphing.
data_processing.6: Supplementary files format and content: bigWig
